summary: Diff adds a Motoko backend with product/inquiry storage plus a React storefront shell (routing, layout, header/footer), catalog grid with filtering/sorting, cart UI/state usage, home section components, and a contact form wired to backend mutation. Key gaps remain around product detail retrieval API and demo product seeding/image paths.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend exposes query methods to list products and get product details.
missing_requirements.reason: Backend implements getProducts() but no query method to fetch a single product by id (e.g., getProduct/getProductById) is present in the shown backend actor.

missing_requirements.requirement: Seed the application with a curated set of 100 demo products that reference locally generated static product images; first-time deploy shows populated catalog with 100 products.
missing_requirements.reason: Backend product map starts empty and requires an explicit initializeDemoProducts() call; no evidence of automatic initialization on first deploy. Additionally, seeded imageUrl values point to "images/<id>.jpg" rather than the required frontend static generated assets path.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication provider/hooks added and used to create authenticated/anonymous actors.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest did not require authentication (and explicitly notes third-party auth beyond Internet Identity is not required for this template). Adding II is extra scope not requested by any REQ.

hallucinated_features.description: Footer includes an outbound marketing/referral link to caffeine.ai with UTM parameters.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not request any external referral/marketing links in the template.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend provides addProduct() mutation for arbitrary product insertion.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest requires listing and getting product details plus seeding demo products; it does not request an API for adding products from the client.
